summary: This document is an email chain from June 23, 2020, discussing difficulties in matching Computer Analysis and Response Team (CART) evidence numbers with item numbers from the Jeffrey Epstein investigation. The sender attaches a spreadsheet and notes complexities like multiple hard drives per item.

events.title: Email exchange regarding CART evidence matching
events.description: An email exchange occurs where an individual sends a spreadsheet (EpsteinNYEvidence.xlsx) to assist in matching CART evidence numbers with item numbers from the Epstein investigation, noting difficulties and the presence of multiple hard drives in some items.

keyFacts: An email from June 23, 2020, discusses matching CART (Computer Analysis and Response Team) evidence numbers with item numbers from the Jeffrey Epstein investigation.
A spreadsheet named 'EpsteinNYEvidence.xlsx' is attached to the email as a reference for the evidence.
The correspondence notes a complexity: some evidence items contained multiple hard drives, causing potential mapping issues between CART numbers and item numbers.
The document is marked as 'SUBJECT TO PROTECTIVE ORDER' referencing specific paragraphs, indicating restricted access to its contents.
The sender indicates they cannot access the physical items until the following morning, highlighting an ongoing evidence review process.
